article.headline: Ryanair to cut capacity 20% as COVID-19 cases rise
article.body: Ryanair Holdings PLC on Monday said it will reduce its flight capacity by 20% in September and October as recent rises in Covid-19 cases across Europe weighed on forward bookings. The budget airline said the majority of the cuts would be frequency reduction rather than route closures, and will be focused on countries where the pandemic is seeing a resurgence in cases--namely Spain, France and Sweden. "These capacity cuts and frequency reductions for the months of September and October are necessary given the recent weakness in forward bookings due to Covid-19 restrictions in a number of EU countries," a spokesperson said. Write to Adriano Marchese at adriano.marchese@wsj.com
